comment.author: 55198937@N05
comment._content: Another view of the building and rickety bridge (c1900) - from Powerhouse Museum: With interesting comments from beachcomber and bob meade: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/3251834377/in/photostream/] and a side view from further up the hill at left: www.powerhousemuseum.com/collection/database/?irn=385883&...

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: And equivalent works of art ... Etching, National Gallery of Australia Old Mosman (1890) by A. H. Fullwood Watercolour, National Gallery of Australia [Old Mosman whaling station] (1899) by A. H. Fullwood [http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet/galleries/72157624765851888]

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Wonderful! The railings are not yet built (see note), so earlier than the Phillips Collection photo. GoogleMapsStreetView has improved considerably for this spot since I last looked nearly four years ago.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/angeljim46] Please forgive my youthful exuberance and excitement on the comments of the Phillips photo - it was identifying that particular Phillips image location  which first hooked me into these old photos.  Oh dear ... !

comment.author: 55198937@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet]  Excellent contribution. Your research, with bob meade,  has greatly expanded the  historical record and context.
